required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Robotic-assisted Versus Conventional Total Knee Arthroplasty
clinical_study.official_title: Robotic-assisted Versus Conventional Total Knee Arthroplasty: A Multicenter and Randomized Controlled Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock:
This is a multicenter, prospective and randomized controlled pre-market clinical Trial. Study subjects will be randomized into one of two operative groups: 1) TKA assisted with ROSA® Knee System; 2) TKA with conventional surgical instrumentation.
The objective of this clinical trial is to measure the effectiveness and safety of the ROSA® Knee System in assisting surgeons with bone resections and implant positioning optimization through early clinical and radiographic outcomes compared with conventional surgical instrumentation in total knee arthroplasty (TKA).

primary_outcome.description: Deviation from neutral mechanical axis alignment based on full-leg weight-bearing X-ray at 6 weeks (±2 week) postoperatively.

secondary_outcome.description: Coronal Lower Limb Alignment based on full-leg weight-bearing X-ray at 6 weeks (±2 week) postoperatively.

arm_group.arm_group_label: TKA assisted with ROSA® Knee System
arm_group.description: TKA assisted with ROSA® Knee System

intervention.arm_group_label: TKA assisted with ROSA® Knee System
